wikipedia_page.main: William Kidd (31 January 1908 – 1978) was a professional footballer who played for Chesterfield FC for the whole of his professional career. He was born in Pegswood.

response: | Oldest player||Billy Kidd: 40 years 232 daysChesterfield oldest debutants and oldest players

Hepworth was born in 1919 in Barnsley, which was then in the West Riding of Yorkshire. His father, Walter, played League football for Barnsley in the 1890s and his older brother Arthur played for Nelson in the late 1920s. He played football for local club Stainborough United before signing amateur forms for Chesterfield in December 1935. The club retained his services until 1939, and he played for their reservesin 1937–38 he made 31 appearances for their Central League teambut could not dislodge Billy Kidd from the first team.
